snippet: The case of a woman who was expelled from a graduate counseling program highlights how religious views on sexual orientation provoke controversy in the profession.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column on whether a professional counselor's religious convictions can be grounds for disqualification from the profession; cites case of Julea Ward, teacher and evangelical Christian who did not want to treat a gay counseling client and was expelled from her graduate program at Eastern Michigan University.
lead_paragraph: The case of a woman who was expelled from a graduate counseling program highlights how religious views on sexual orientation provoke controversy in the profession.

headline.print_headline: A Counselor’s Convictions Put Her Profession on Trial
headline.seo: When Counseling and Conviction Collide — Beliefs
headline.main: A Counselor’s Convictions Put Her Profession on Trial
